name: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA
mission: CAIR works to protect and defend the constitutional rights of American Muslims, thereby supporting the rights of all Americans.
theoryOfChange: By combining legal action, policy advocacy, and community empowerment, CAIR-CA seeks to dismantle systemic Islamophobia and protect the constitutional rights of Muslims.

evaluationSources: Yuri Kochiyama Impact Award (Asian Law Caucus)
M. Shanara Gilbert Human Rights Award (Society of American Law Teachers)
ChangeMaker Award (South Asian Americans Leading Together)
Fred Korematsu Civil Rights award (American Muslim Voice Foundation)
Unsung Hero Award (National Lawyers Guild-SF Chapter)

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ca.cair.com/zakat (Source: https://ca.cair.com/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: ADVOCACY (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 34/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ca.cair.com/zakat (Source: https://ca.cair.com/zakat)

all_citations.claim: CAIR-CA maintains a program expense ratio of 83.7%, 14.5 months of working capital, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.07 per $1 raised.
The organization reported a total revenue of $17,442,755 in the 2023 fiscal year.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and applies funds toward eligible asnaf categories including those in debt and in the way of Allah.
Donors are provided with multiple giving methods to support civil rights, policy advocacy, and media relations programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: CAIR-CA earns a solid 70/100 due to its high financial efficiency and critical role in civil rights advocacy, though its score is tempered by the inherent difficulty in measuring the direct impact of capacity-building work.
areas_for_improvement: Increasing transparency regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics to further validate impact data.
Expanding public reporting on long-term outcomes of policy and advocacy programs.

dimension_explanations.alignment: CAIR-CA shows high alignment with donor needs by maintaining Zakat eligibility and providing clear pathways for religious giving [3][4]. The organization addresses urgent advocacy needs for the Muslim community, backed by a high data confidence level and a proven track record in civil rights defense [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates strong financial health with a total revenue of $17,442,755 and a program expense ratio of 83.7%, indicating that resources are prioritized for mission-critical services [1][2]. While its capacity-building model makes direct cost-per-beneficiary metrics complex to calculate, its 14.5 months of working capital suggests high organizational stability [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California (CAIR-CA) serves as a leading legal and advocacy organization dedicated to protecting the civil liberties of American Muslims.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 83.7% ensures the vast majority of funds directly support civil rights and advocacy work.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.07 per $1 raised.
Strong liquidity position with 14.5 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: CAIR-CA operates as a grassroots civil rights and advocacy group focused on defending constitutional rights through legal services, policy initiatives, and media relations [1][2]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through contributions that support social justice and community empowerment [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: CAIR-CA earns a solid 70/100 due to its high financial efficiency and critical role in civil rights advocacy, though its score is tempered by the inherent difficulty in measuring the direct impact of capacity-building work.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the organization tracks some outcomes, it lacks specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics to fully assess the cost-effectiveness of its legal and advocacy programs.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization tracks multiple outcome metrics and maintains exceptional program expense ratios.
risk_factors: Lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data for legal and advocacy programs
case_against.summary: Limited concerns regarding financial efficiency, though impact measurement could be strengthened.

data_gaps: Not fully rated by Charity Navigator
confidence.notes: Strong financial data availability, though impact metrics are limited.

known_gaps: Not fully rated by Charity Navigator

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors seeking to support civil rights, with <cite id="3">verified Zakat eligibility</cite> and a clear focus on defending the constitutional rights of American Muslims.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust CAIR-CA due to its strong financial transparency, evidenced by its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid and detailed Form 990 reporting showing <cite id="2">$17,442,755 in revenue</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the organization could pursue full rating evaluation from independent charity evaluators.

impact.explanation: Operations show exceptional efficiency with a <cite id="2">83.7% program expense ratio</cite> and highly efficient fundraising at <cite id="1">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service and advocacy rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California (CAIR-CA) serves as a leading legal and advocacy organization dedicated to protecting the civil liberties of American Muslims.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support civil rights advocacy and legal defense for American Muslims through highly efficient, Zakat-eligible contributions.
donor_motivations: Want to protect the civil liberties of American Muslims
Value highly efficient organizations with low overhead
Seek to fulfill Zakat obligations through advocacy and legal support
giving_considerations: Impact in legal and advocacy work can be long-term and difficult to quantify on a per-dollar basis
Focus is primarily regional (California) rather than international
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking direct humanitarian relief or international development programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks outcome metrics and has a documented theory of change, though specific cost-per-beneficiary data is limited.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: CAIR-CA aims to enhance the understanding of Islam and encourage dialogue to promote an accurate image of Muslims while protecting civil liberties.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: In advocacy and legal defense, tracking outcomes helps ensure strategies effectively protect civil rights and influence public understanding.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Strong revenue growth and high program efficiency suggest capacity to absorb additional funding for expanded advocacy efforts.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its specific focus on American Muslim civil liberties and exceptional <cite id="2">83.7% program expense ratio</cite> compared to the <cite id="1">peer median of 77.5%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus: advocacy legal, same size
similar_organizations.name: IMRC

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus: advocacy legal, same size
similar_organizations.name: Innocence Project

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus: advocacy legal, same size
similar_organizations.name: Project South

strengths.detail: The organization directs a <cite id="2">83.7% program expense ratio</cite> toward its mission, significantly exceeding the <cite id="1">industry standard of 75%</cite>.
CAIR-CA demonstrates strong financial stewardship with a fundraising cost of just <cite id="1">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>.
The organization has demonstrated significant financial momentum, achieving a <cite id="2">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 49.7%</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: CAIR-CA demonstrates exceptional financial efficiency in its operations. With a <cite id="2">83.7% program expense ratio</cite>, the vast majority of funding directly supports civil rights and advocacy work. This efficiency is further highlighted by its fundraising costs, requiring only <cite id="1">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization has also experienced substantial growth, with revenue increasing from approximately $7.7 million in 2021 to <cite id="2">$17,442,755 in 2023</cite>, representing a <cite id="2">49.7% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California (CAIR-CA) serves as a leading legal and advocacy organization dedicated to protecting the civil liberties of American Muslims. The organization reported <cite id="2">$17,442,755 in total revenue</cite> for 2023, directing a <cite id="2">83.7% program expense ratio</cite> toward its core mission. CAIR-CA operates with exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="1">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization's programs span civil rights protection, legal services, and community education across California. CAIR-CA is <cite id="3">Zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing donors to support advocacy and legal defense through their religious giving.
